member.summary: Exposes methods to run post-build checks and fail the build if the checks fail.

member.name: M:RT.PostBuild.PostBuildChecker.RunPostBuildChecks(System.String,System.Reflection.Assembly[])
member.summary: Runs all post-build checks defined in the specified assemblies. This is intended to be run as a post-build event. See remarks for details.

remarks.para: In non-DEBUG mode, does nothing and returns 0.

description.para: Add the following line to your project's post-build event:
Add the following code at the beginning of your project's Main() method:
If your project entails several assemblies, you can specify additional assemblies in the call to . For example, you could specify typeof(SomeTypeInMyLibrary).Assembly.
Add post-build check methods to any type where they may be relevant. For example, you might use code similar to the following:

The method is expected to have one parameter of type , a return type of void, and it is expected to be static and non-public. Errors and warnings can be reported by calling methods on said object. (In the above example, PostBuildChecker will attempt to find a class called Gizmo to link the error message to a location in the source.) Throwing an exception will also report an error.

member.param: Specifies the path to the folder containing the C# source files.
Specifies the compiled assemblies from which to run post-build checks.
member.returns: 1 if any errors occurred, otherwise 0.

member.name: M:RT.Util.ExtensionMethods.CollectionExtensions.BinarySearch``2(System.Collections.Generic.SortedList{``0,``1},``0,System.Int32@,System.Int32@)
member.summary: Performs a binary search for the specified key on a . When no match exists, returns the nearest indices for interpolation/extrapolation purposes.
member.remarks: If an exact match exists, index1 == index2 == the index of the match. If an exact match is not found, index1 < index2. If the key is less than every key in the list, index1 is int.MinValue and index2 is 0. If it's greater than every key, index1 = last item index and index2 = int.MaxValue. Otherwise index1 and index2 are the indices of the items that would surround the key were it present in the list.
member.param: List to operate on.
The key to look for.
Receives the value of the first index (see remarks).
Receives the value of the second index (see remarks).
